page.title: 05NORTHBURY PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: Our school is the oldest school building in Barking. It was built in 1895. In our area live many people of different races and religions. There are people from Scotland, Ireland, India, Pakistan, Bangladesh, the West Indies as well as English children. Most of the pupils here were born in England but many parents are from abroad. We have many different religions: Christians, Moslems, Sikhs, Hindus and others. There is a {Sikh {Temple} nearby. Many children go there to worship or learn Punjabi. There is also a Baptist Church which has a Sunday School and the {Boys' Brigade. There is a modern Catholic Church near with a pretty window. Mnay of our pupils go out of the area to visit their mosque. Children at our school may speak two or even three languages. There are six languages in all.
